{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3535990,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T01:41:08.302Z","cooked":"

6619 is working on using PathPlanner on the fly path generation to align to the reef in teleop. We have 1 LL4 and a NavX2 that we are using for finding the pose of the robot. Right now, we can find the pose of the robot using the LL4 and we have a command in Swerve.java where we have the FollowPathCommand. Currently, a path is generated and when we hold down the button it runs a path, but it does not seem to be going to the right place and it when we let go of the button it keeps moving until we E-stop. We’ve read the documentation a lot and can’t find a solution to our issue. We’ve included a video of the behavior (the google drive link) and our AlignToTag code in Sweve.java.

Video: On the Fly Problems.MOV - Google Drive

        waypoints = PathPlannerPath.waypointsFromPoses(
            getPoseEstimate(),
            new Pose2d(3, 4.01, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(300-180))
        );
            PathPlannerPath path = new PathPlannerPath(
                waypoints, 
                constraints, 
                null, 
                new GoalEndState(0.0, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0)));

                path.preventFlipping = true;
                
                return new FollowPathCommand(
                    path, 
                    this::getPoseEstimate,
                    this::getChassisSpeeds, 
                    (speeds, feedforwards) -> autoDrive(speeds),
                    new PPHolonomicDriveController(
                        new PIDConstants(5.0, 0.0, 0.0),
                        new PIDConstants(5.0, 0.0, 0.0) 
                        ), 
                    Constants.Swerve.robotConfig, 
                    () -> false, 
                    this);
                    
    }

It seems that your robot is not reaching the pose that you are trying to get to so and the command therefore never finishes. Can you verify with the telemetry tab of PathPlanner whether it is actually reaching the pose you want it to go to? Is the odometry of the robot decently accurate outside of PathPlanner?

I’ll check that later today. We know that our LL gets an accurate field position, and are pretty sure that the odometry is accurate as well. Thanks for the suggestion.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T19:07:59.446Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":38.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"Simon Kozioziemski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65511,"username":"ntnx0246","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/3","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3536769,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-22T23:05:57.892Z","cooked":"

I checked the telemetry and it seems that it is generating the path correctly, but it does not properly follow it. The telemetry seems to show the correct location, and it mirrors the robots movement, but neither the robot or the view in the telemetry are following the path that is shown in the telemetry.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-22T23:05:57.892Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"Simon Kozioziemski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65511,"username":"ntnx0246","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/4","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537336,"name":"","username":"ntnx0246","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T19:02:44.911Z","cooked":"

Could you try to see if the odometry is working?
You can do this but putting the estimated pose onto a field in SmartDashboard. It may be that there was a unit conversion error which would throw it off.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T19:02:44.911Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70239,"username":"Simon6619","name":"Simon Kozioziemski","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/5","custom_user_title":"Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537353,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T19:29:45.015Z","cooked":"

We swapped out the odometry for SwerveDrivePoseEstimator and put that on the field and it worked correctly. However, in the PathPlanner telemetry the robot position only updates while running a path. We might have to change something in PathPlanner to make it use pose estimator instead of odometry.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T19:29:45.015Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":156,"readers_count":155,"score":41.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"Simon Kozioziemski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65511,"username":"ntnx0246","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/6","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537367,"name":"","username":"ntnx0246","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T19:42:58.520Z","cooked":"

Can you make sure the getPoseEstimate function is returning SwerveDrivePoseEstimator pos? This is how PathPlanner knows where your robot is as it follows a path.

It does return the SwerveDrivePoseEstimator pos.

So when you run the path, does the robot seem to follow the path created in telemetry?

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T22:21:43.287Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":136,"readers_count":135,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70239,"username":"Simon6619","name":"Simon Kozioziemski","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/9","custom_user_title":"Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537504,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-23T22:31:39.723Z","cooked":"

It seems to follow the path but angle is rapidly changing, causing it to go not follow it very well and jerk around a lot.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-23T22:31:39.723Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":37.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"Simon Kozioziemski","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65511,"username":"ntnx0246","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70239,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/10","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537738,"name":"","username":"ntnx0246","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/bcef8e/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T05:21:50.101Z","cooked":"

Could you try a path without rotation to see if that works and verify that the cause of this is trying to rotate?

It seems that setting the states of the modules is not being done correctly which may cause it to go in random directions.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T05:21:50.101Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":31.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":70239,"username":"Simon6619","name":"Simon Kozioziemski","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65511,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/11","custom_user_title":"Software Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537756,"name":"steinra","username":"steinra","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/steinra/{size}/3823_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T06:41:10.003Z","cooked":"

What does your AutoBuild.Configure look like? It should be getting the pose in the method assigned there.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-24T06:41:10.003Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":29.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"steinra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70239,"username":"Simon6619","name":"Simon Kozioziemski","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10996,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3537759,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-24T06:58:23.576Z","cooked":"

I believe it is getting the pose, but I could be wrong.

AutoBuilder.configure(
            this::getPoseEstimate, // Robot pose supplier
            this::setPoseEstimate, // Method to reset odometry (will be called if your auto has a starting pose)
            this::getChassisSpeeds, // ChassisSpeeds supplier. MUST BE ROBOT RELATIVE
            (speeds, feedforwards) -> autoDrive(speeds), // Method that will drive the robot given ROBOT RELATIVE ChassisSpeeds. Also optionally outputs individual module feedforwards
            new PPHolonomicDriveController( // PPHolonomicController is the built in path following controller for holonomic drive trains
                    new com.pathplanner.lib.config.PIDConstants(5.0, 0.0, 0.0), // Translation PID constants
                    new com.pathplanner.lib.config.PIDConstants(5.0, 0.0, 0.0) // Rotation PID constants
            ),

I can try that. Is there a way to guarantee that the path won’t have rotation, or do I just have to make sure it is already facing the way it will end?

Also, our field image on SmartDashboard always shows that the robot is facing 90 degrees to the right of where it really is. While driving there are no issues, but I’m wondering if that could possibly be the source of the issue.

It looks like you are using the getPoseEstimate, are you merging camera and drive odometry into your pose estimation?

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":27,"updated_at":"2025-02-25T02:30:21.480Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":16,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":36.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":492662,"topic_slug":"issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation","display_username":"steinra","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":70239,"username":"Simon6619","name":"Simon Kozioziemski","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10996,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/issues-with-pathplanner-on-the-fly-generation/492662/17","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3539064,"name":"Simon Kozioziemski","username":"Simon6619","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/simon6619/{size}/251071_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-25T05:06:30.228Z","cooked":"

In our code, we had issues actually defining the front of the robot (help with that would be greatly appreciated) so we partly solved our issue by making 2 separate methods to set the gyro depending on what it was being used for. This is because there was a disconnect where the gyro for driving the swerve with joysticks in teleop was 90 degrees of from the gyro of other driving functions (autoalign, auto). We threw together a quick fix, but it seems like it is causing issues. Our poseEstimator field on SmartDashboard uses the getAutoGyroYaw method, so it shows the robot facing 90 degrees off but the driving updates fine. If we changed our code so AutoGyro and regular gyro matched, on SmartDashboard the robot would be facing the right way but all the controls would be inverted.
Our code:

public Rotation2d getGyroYaw() {
        /* Note: February 19, 2025: This used to have a value of 360-gyro.getAngle() in the 2024 branch. */
        /* The getAngle function returned values the total yaw value, which can be larger than 360 degrees
         * as the robot rotated multiple times.  getYaw goes from -180 to + 180 degrees. This function was
         * getYaw() in the 2024 branch. 
         */
        return Rotation2d.fromDegrees(360-gyro.getYaw());
    }

    public Rotation2d getAutoGyroYaw() {
        return Rotation2d.fromDegrees(360-gyro.getYaw()-90);
    }

If you know of any place where we can definitively set the front of the robot, that would be great.
